gui.model.domain

Class Term

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.model.domain.Term

  • public class Term
extends java.lang.Object
    A term represents a single unit the domain model. Each term can contain a list of children terms. A term can represent domain, sub-domain or a single term. The hierarchy of terms in the domain models represents the hierarchy or domains and sub-domains in a domain.
    Each term is extracted from a UI component, which we call the "target component".
    Each term contains the basic domain information, which can be extracted from the target component:
    • name - primary domain information, which we are able to extract from a component
    • description - secondary domain information, which we are able to extract from a component (such as tooltip) - description can provide additional information about the term
    • relation - the relation between this term's children
    • parentRelation - the relation, which transfers to this term's parent
    • icon - sometimes, if there is no textual information available in the target component, an icon can contain domain information
    • labelForComponent - if there is no textual information available in the target component, a JLabel can provide additional domain information
    • constraints - the constraints for the term, such as: length, range, enumeration, etc.

    Each term contains a reference to the domain model in which it is located, to the target component and to its class.
    Author:
    Michaela Bacikova, Slovakia, michaela.bacikova@tuke.sk

      • getIcon

        public javax.swing.Icon getIcon()
        Sometimes, even if a component does not have any textual description, it can have an icon, which explains its meaning. This icon can be graphical or textual, but either way it can contain valuable domain information.
        Returns:
        the icon associated with this term

      • getLabelForComponent

        public javax.swing.JLabel getLabelForComponent()
        Sometimes, if the component has no domain information, it is described by a label. The association between the component and the label component is set by the "labelFor" attribute of the JLabel component.
        Returns:
        reference to a JLabel component, which describes this component.

      • isDirectSiblingTo

        public boolean isDirectSiblingTo(Term to)
        This method returns true, if this term is a direct sibling to to, false if not. Direct sibling means, that in the list of all siblings of this node's parent, the to term is right next to this term.
        Parameters:
        to - the second sibling
        Returns:
        true if this term is a direct sibling to to, false otherwise

      • removeAllWithNesting

        public void removeAllWithNesting(java.util.List<Term> childrenToRemove)

        Parameters:

      • removeEmptyLeafs

        public boolean removeEmptyLeafs()
        Removes all leafs with no relevant domain information from this term children recursively.
        |_x |_x
        |_o |_x
        |_x ==>
        |_o

        x - term with relevant domain information
        o - term with no relevant domain information

        Returns:
        true if anything has been removed, false otherwise

      • removeMultipleNestings

        public boolean removeMultipleNestings()
        This method does the following for all children of this term recursively: If node without any relevant information has any number of children and no siblings, shift the children to its parent and remove the node.
        o o o
        |_o |_o |_x
        |_o ==> |_x ==> |_x
        |_x |_x
        |_x

        x - term with relevant domain information
        o - term with no relevant domain information

        Returns:
        true if anything has been removed, false otherwise

      • shiftSingleChildLeafs

        public boolean shiftSingleChildLeafs()
        If there are terms, which have only one child and the child is a leaf, then this leaf is moved to its grandparent and its parent is removed. Recursive function.
        Parent-Grandparent-Leaf ==> Parent-Leaf
        Returns:
        true if anything was shifted, false otherwise

      • removeTermsOfInfoType

        public boolean removeTermsOfInfoType(ComponentInfoType infoType)
        Removes all terms of the given component info type.
        Parameters:
        infoType - the component info type, according to which the terms should be removed
        Returns:
        true if anything was removed, false otherwise

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • removeDomainInformation

        public void removeDomainInformation()
        Removes all domain information from this term, which includes:
        • setting its name to null
        • setting its relation to default (RelationType.AND)
        • setting its description to null
        • setting its label component to null
        • setting its icon to null
